result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:37 AM cases 20CT302, 21CF937, 21CT81, 22CF463 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael P Porter in court without counsel. 
Defendant has applied for counsel and qualifies for SPD representation. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7/25/22 at 2:15 PM.

Cases called at 10:23 AM: 20CT302, 21CF937, 21CT81, 22CF463.
Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael P Porter in court without counsel.
Defendant advised to seek counsel and notes he will apply for a Public Defender.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/13/22 at 3:30 PM.
Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(Cases 22CF463, 21CF937, 21CT81, 20CF302 are called at 11:01 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Michael Porter appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Karl Schmidt. ADA Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants in 21CF937, 21CT81, 20CF302 are executed. Defense waives reading of the complaint in 22CF463. State requests that bond be continued in 21CF937, 21CT81, 20CF302 and requests $1,000 cash bond in 22CF463. Defense requests signature bond or lower cash bond in 22CF463. Court orders bond continues in 21CF937, 21CT81, 20CF302 and orders $500 cash bond in 22CF463. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived in 22CF463. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 05/09/2022 at 2:00 PM.  Hearing: 05/26/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
